issue.description: MIM needs to interface with Extended_measure_representation

comment.description: Accept. Added.

issue.description: ARM needs to interface with Extended_measure_representation

comment.description: Accept. Added.

issue.description: MIM needs to USE FROM qualified_measure_schema.measure_qualification

comment.description: Accept. Added to mim, also added value_qualifier, to be explicit.

issue.description: Mapping of value range uses compound_representation_item instead of qualified measure_representation.

comment.description: This is a major harmonization issue.

issue.description: Mapping of envelope principle is not harmonized with AP224.

comment.description: This is a major harmonization issue.

issue.description: Harmonization with ISO 10303-214 is required. Resolution of AP214 SEDS 887-896 and AM 1050 should be consistent.

Angular_location_dimension.orientation The definition of the attribute orientation is not clear. Does the attribute define a kind of reference plane for measurement of the angle? Improve the textual definition. Consider to add an explanatory figure.
4.3.7 Limits_and_fits attribute definitions The notes are not numbered.

comment.description: See UK9

issue.description: 4.3.9 Location_dimension directed attribute definition A reference to the name of the own entity has a link. Remove the link and leave the reference in bold letters.
4.3.10 Plus_minus_bounds attribute definitions The numbering of the notes is incorrect.

comment.description: See UK12

issue.description: 5.1 Mapping specification The attribute Location_dimension.origin has not been mapped to the extended select placed_element_select
The attribute Size_dimension.applied_to has not been mapped to the extended select element_with_dimension_select
Figure D.1 The entities used from representation_schema are related to Elemental_geometric_shape_mim.

comment.description: Because of limitations of the tools, in order for the diagram links to work properly, whenever an interfaced entity is referenced , it is necessary to explicitly USE FROM the schema where the interfaced entity is originally defined, regardless of any indirect interfacing that may exist. Not sure that this is correct interpretation of issue?

issue.description: In SC4 Poitiers Meeting, WG3/T24 manufacturing team determined to establish an Ad-Hoc committee for the harmonization of Geometric and Dimensional Tolerance defined in AP 214, AP 224 and AM 1050. It is required to harmonize the definition and the representation of the dimensional tolerance with AP 214 and AP 224.

ARM entity Location_dimension is mapped to the resource entity dimensional_location (Part 47), which represents the relative location between a pair of shape aspects. However, the following two attributes, origin and target, may be a geometric_representation_item, such as Axis_placement.origin: the element that is the origin for the Location_dimension.target: the element that is the target for the Location_dimension. Confirm the consistency with the dimensional_location in Part 47.
EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Location_dimension Attribute: Directed Remove attribute - directed to harmonize

comment.description: Any dimension can be directed. SEDS has been submitted against AP214.

issue.description: Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Angular_location_dimension Attribute: orientation Remove attribute - orientation to harmonize Add attributes: mirror_target, Major_angle, origin_determination

comment.description: Angular_location_dimension.orientation orientation is needed to determine correct sense of rotation. SEDS submitted against AP214.

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Linear_distance_dimension Attribute missing - directed Remove attribute - directed to harmonize

comment.description: Attribute is on supertype Location_dimension

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Size_dimension Attribute - envelope_principle Remove attribute - envelope_principle to harmonize

comment.description: The envelope principle simultaneously controls size and form and is potentially applicable to any feature of size (FOS), regardless of how the dimension and or tolerance are specified.

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 1,2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP214e2Geometric_dimension Attribute dimensional_valueDimensional_value references a select type: dimension_value_select. One of the items in the selection is Dimension_value_with_limitations. This entity does not define a value that the plus_minus_bounds, or limits_and_fits is applied to. Harmonize with AP214e2 and define a numerical_value to apply the dimensional tolerance.

comment.description: Added attribute Dimension_value_with_limitation.limited_value as a Numerical_item_with_unit.

issue.description: EXPRESS-G ARM Diagram 2 Technical Not Harmonized with AP224e2Sub types for Size_dimension missing Harmonize with AP224e2 Add these subtypes:Radial_dimension Angular_size_dimension Curved_dimension Diameter_dimension

comment.description:
Angular_size_dimension exists in ARM. Minor difference from 224 in one arm attribute: full_or_half vs full , mapping the same.
For the others, Propose instead, to maintain 214 harmonization to add as values for General_size_dimension.dimension_type, in the form "when applicable the following values shall be used.
Added text strings to be used where applicable, to the ARM descriptions and also as alternative constrained mappings. This method of specifying an open list was is consistent with an agreement between AP214e1 project team and SC4 quality.

issue.description: Major Technical There are many APs using dimensional tolerances: AP224, AP240, AP219, AP238, AP214, AP223, etc It is very important that this module be harmonized with those APs.Currently all of the APs are trying to harmonize with AP214e2. Harmonize module with AP214e2
Does not specify how to encode taper ratios Document, possibly as ratio units
Does not specify how to encode fractional dimensions Document, possibly as ratio units.

No way is given to distinguish theoretically exact ("basic") dimensions from dimensions that may be affected by default tolerances. Create new ARM entity type (ref AP210) THEORETICALLY_EXACT_DIMENSION_REPRESENTATION maps to {shape_dimension_representation <=shape_representation <=representationrepresentation.items[1] ->representation_item =>measure_representation_item <=measure_with_unit <-measure_qualification.qualified_measuremeasure_qualification{measure_qualification.name = `dimension value qualifier'}measure_qualification.qualifiers[i] ->value_qualifiervalue_qualifier = type_qualifiertype_qualifier{type_qualifier.name = `theoretically exact'}}

No way is provided to associate qualifiers to tolerance values. not_convex, not_concave, free_state, each_element, each_radial_element, major_diameter, minor_diameter, pitch_diameter. Add constructs similar to TOLERANCE_QUALIFIER (ref AP210), etc or give examples of using qualifiers, (possibly in AP203e2 )
No way is documented to specify a statistical tolerance and alternate tolerance for dimensional tolerance
Incomplete support for dimension characterstics. Examples: angular, arc length, controlled radius, diameter, spherical diameter linear, radius Add missing ones.

4.3.8Linear_distance_dimension. Name is misleading because linear refers to measures of length whether straight or not. Change to Straight_distance_dimension, and change mapping string to "straight distance"
Not clear if concept of auxiliary dimension is to be supported Clarify and add if missing.
4.3.12 No indication is given of when this might be used. Add example of retained thickness of a blind hole, or of a web, if these are appropriate.

The representation of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing in ISO 10303-1050 is not harmonized with existing representations in already published ISO 10303 standards. Both ISO 10303-214 and 224 have geometric dimensioning and tolerancing. These APs have some harmonization issues to resolve and ISO 10303-1050 should take part in that harmonization effort.
Diagram 2 Major Technical This module has not been harmonised with AP224 edition 2 (or Ap214 edition 2). Harmonise with AP224 edition 2.

Diagram 2 Technical Not harmonised with AP224 edition 2Linear_distance_dimension has an optional attribute orientation but has not a directed attribute as found in AP224 edition2 Location_dimension_tolerance Harmonise with AP224 edition 2 by adding directed attribute.

Diagram 2 Technical Not harmonised with AP224 edition 2Angular_location_dimension has an optional attribute orientation but not the major_angle mirror_target or mirror_termination attribute present in AP224 edition2 Angular_dimension_tolerance Harmonise with AP224 edition 2 by removing orientation attribute and adding major_angle, mirror_target and mirror_termination.

Diagram 2 Technical Not harmonised with AP224 edition 2Size_dimension has an attribute envelope_principle which is not present in AP224 edition2 Size_tolerance. However, Applied_shape from AP224 edition 2 is not present. Harmonise with AP224 edition 2 by removing envelope_principle attribute and adding attribute Applied_shape.
In-scope point 4 "dimensions of size", please clarify.Out-scope point 6 "presentaion", please clarify.

comment.description: Accept. Improved text and added examples for point 4. Expanded wording for point 6.

issue.description: Curved_distance_dimension.used_pathDefinition incomplete

comment.description: Accept. Fixed by completing the definition

issue.description: Dimension_value_with_limitiation Definition and definition of "defined_by" are not understandable.

comment.description: An attribute defined_by was accidentally left out of the ARM. Added this attribute and changed descriptions of entity and attributes.

issue.description: Geometric_dimensionEXPRESS-G (diagram C2) does not agree with the EXPRESS, in that it omits the ONEOF constraint

comment.description: Accept. Authoring tool does not support this. Will fix by editing the final diagram.

issue.description: Limits_and_fits Examples and notes incorrectly numbered

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: Limits_and_fits:deviation The scope and meaning of the parameter is not correctly defined. It should explicitly reference ISO 286 as the source of valid values

comment.description: Accept.

issue.description: Limits_and_fits:Fitting_type The description suggests that this should be an enumeration. Otherwise, some definition of the valid strings is required. (Classification with External_class_library is another option).

comment.description: Accept in principle. This attribute is redundant, or at least could be derived . However it is required for AP214 harmonization. For harmonization reasons, propose this issue be addressed in an implementation module. Text with applicable strings will be added to ARM description.

issue.description: Plus_minus_bounds Note numbering out of sequence

comment.description: Accept. Fixed.

issue.description: Plus_minus_boundsAccording to the mapping, the values in the EXAMPLE are normative, and should be part of the attribute definition. This would be better either as an enumeration or done through classification

comment.description: Reject. This wording and mapping were per SC4 agreement when AP214 was developed. It is retained for harmonizations. NOTE classification may be added at the implementation level.

issue.description: The mappings are unsafe, in that it may not be possible to recover the meaning of the ARM when examining, say, a part 21 file. It is strongly recommended that the mappings are re-examined from this point of view, and that the mapping path is constrained, for example, by a representation_contex

comment.description: Please provide a concrete example.

issue.description: Dimension_value_with_limitation.envelope_principle Mapping incorrect. There is no way of telling a TRUE from a FALSE

comment.description: Accept. Changed text and added alternative mappings.

issue.description: Size_dimension.envelope_principle Mapping incorrect. There is no way of telling a TRUE from a FALSE

comment.description: Accept. Changed description in ARM and added alternative mappings.
